name: Advance Radar Systems
desc: Improves the sight radius of detection systems to easily detect enemies during combat.

name: Beam Combiners
desc: Installs partial reflectors that combine two or more wavelengths of light to increase the power of beam weapons.

name: Circuit Breakers
desc: Protects certain subsystems during an overload, reducing the time it takes to recover from an overload.

name: Convicted Crewmates
desc: Replaces the standard crew qualifications to include court-martialled or convicted space veterans.

name: External Cargo Holds
desc: A merchant's cheap way of increasing profits and margins by attaching cargo to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: External Cryo Pods
desc: Puts crew, passengers or marines into cryostasis pods and attaches them to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: External Fuel Tanks
desc: A cheap way of extending expeditions by attaching fuel tanks or barrels to anchor points around a combat ship.

name: Flux Amplifiers
desc: Installs flux inverters and dynamos to increase the overall force and power of non-missile weapons.

name: Flux Conduction Armor
desc: Replaces the ships armor with flux conductive materials to store accumulated flux in the armor.

name: Flux Limiters
desc: Replaces resistors and diodes with efficient alternatives to reduce flux usage of non-missile weapons.

name: Front Loaded Armor
desc: An outdated armor modification that strengthens the ship's front armor to make it last longer in face-to-face battles.

name: Fuel Ramscoop
desc: Installs a ramscoop that gathers interstellar matter then converts it into useable fuel.

name: Graviton Attunement Drive
desc: An experimental drive field that attunes the quantum gravitational energy of the fleet, accelerating them through space.

name: Hull Conversion
desc: Replaces specific hull bracings and bulkheads with high density metals, but weakens the ship's structural integrity.

name: Industrial Machine Forge
desc: A facility within the ship is converted into an industrial forge use for creating heavy machinery.

name: Makeshift Missile Autoforge
desc: A crude dedicated autoforge is installed on missile weapons that is only activated when running out of ammo.

name: Marine Training Facility
desc: A section of the ship is converted into a training facility for training marines and converting crew members into marines.

name: Missile Bay
desc: Retrofits a fighter bay in to a missile storage unit.

name: Reactive Shields
desc: Installs an optic focuser on the ship's shield emitter, condensing shield particles towards a focal direction or point.

name: Reactive Subsystems
desc: Replaces subsystems with reactive machines, a basic type of AI that only reacts to its given scenario but cannot go past it.

name: Reactor Bay
desc: Retrofits a fighter bay in to a makeshift reactor.

name: Subverted Shields
desc: Installs an oscillator in the ship's shield emitter, vibrating shield particles, allowing flux to pass through.

name: Targeting Transceiver
desc: Installs a transceiver that communicates with nearby targeting systems, enhancing the ship's weapons accuracy or range.

name: Temporal Flux Reactor
desc: A modified phase cloak that exploits the time dilation within phase-space without going into phase-space.

name: Test Hullmod
desc: Hullmod for testing purposes.

name: Test Stopwatch
desc: Hullmod for timing purposes.

name: Venting Overdrive
desc: An outdated venting protocol that overrides the ship's safety procedures when venting.

name: Volatile Warheads
desc: Replaces the chemicals within conventional missile warheads with volatile and radioactive chemicals.
